reviews.review: Best lecturer I've ever experienced in both high school and college thus far. Get him if you can. I have no idea why he's rated so low.

name: PHYS171H
title: Introductory Physics: Mechanics and Relativity
description: Prerequisite: (MATH140; and a high school physics course); or permission of CMNS-Physics department. And must have completed or be concurrently enrolled in MATH141. Credit only granted for: PHYS141, PHYS161, or PHYS171. First semester of a three semester sequence for physics majors and those desiring a rigorous preparation in the physical sciences: kinematics, Newton's laws, energy and work, linear and angular momenta, temperature and pressure, ideal gas law, and special relativity. In person lecture meetings will occur every other week. Students who can only enroll if the course is fully online will be accommodated, and should contact the instructor. Jointly offered with PHYS171.
